pingball.physics

Class Absorber

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Gadget
      • pingball.physics.Absorber

  • public class Absorber
extends Gadget
    An Absorber is a type of Gadget that has a variable size. An Absorber can be of any size kL * mL where 1 <= m,k <= 20. The dimensions of an Absorber can never force the absorber to exist outside of the playing field of a pingball board. Also Absorbers have a unique trigger and action sequence. When an Absorber is hit by a ball, the ball is immediately captured and put in the Absorber's bottom right corner and stored. Being hit by a ball is also the Absorber's trigger, which causes it to fire the oldest stored ball straight upwards at 50 L/s. If an Absorber no longer is holding a ball or if the previously ejected ball has not yet left the Absorber, no action is taken. An Absorber can self-trigger itself (potentially allowing a ball to be absorbed and fired in a fluid sequence of events).
    Author:
    Erik

    • Constructor Detail

      • Absorber

        public Absorber(Board board,
        java.lang.String name,
        int x,
        int y,
        int width,
        int height)
        Create a new Absorber with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        board - the board that the absorber is in
        name - the name of this Absorber gadget
        x - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of this absorber, 0 <= x < 20
        y - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of this absorber, 0 <= y < 20
        width - the desired width of this absorber, 1 <= width <= 20
        height - the desired height of this absorber, 1 <= height <= 20
